p: Contrary to our second hypothesis, there was no evidence that higher temperatures lead to increased egg hatching fractions (χ 2 = 5.531, P = 0.063) and hatching fractions did not increase with increasing incubation time (χ 2 = 0.027, P = 0.869). However, young eggs were less likely to hatch than old eggs (χ 2 = 8.687, P = 0.003) (Fig. 1c, d; Additional file 4).
